DataElement.preferredName: Genomics Findings Domain DNA Index Result
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result that describes the DNA index.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to genomics findings.:The ratio of the DNA content or chromosome number in a tumor sample compared to that in a normal sample.

Property.preferredDefinition: The ratio of the DNA content or chromosome number in a tumor sample compared to that in a normal sample.

Concepts.definition: The ratio of the DNA content or chromosome number in a tumor sample compared to that in a normal sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The ratio of the DNA content or chromosome number in a tumor sample compared to that in a normal sample._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having two sets of homologous chromosomes.

Concepts.definition: Having two sets of homologous chromosomes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chromosomal abnormality in which the chromosomal number is greater than the normal diploid number.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality in which the chromosomal number is greater than the normal diploid number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failing to meet the quantitative or qualitative measures for the needs of a situation.

Concepts.definition: Failing to meet the quantitative or qualitative measures for the needs of a situation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).
